verses.verse: And the sons <S%H1121><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> did <S%H6213><s%> evil <S%H7451><s%> in the sight <S%H5869><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%>: and the Lord <S%H3068><s%> delivered <S%H5414><s%> them into the hand <S%H3027><s%> of Midian <S%H4080><s%> seven <S%H7651><s%> years <S%H8141><s%>.

And the hand <S%H3027><s%> of Midian <S%H4080><s%> prevailed <S%H5810><s%> against Israel <S%H3478><s%>: and because <S%H6440><s%> of the Midianites <S%H4080><s%> the sons <S%H1121><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> made <S%H6213><s%> them the dens <S%H4492><s%> which are in the mountains <S%H2022><s%>, and caves <S%H4631><s%>, and strong holds <S%H4679><s%>.

And so it was <S%H3478><s%>, when Israel had sown <S%H2232><s%>, that the Midianites <S%H4080><s%> came up <S%H5927><s%>, and the Amalekites <S%H6002><s%>, and the sons <S%H1121><s%> of the east <S%H6924><s%>, even they came up against them <S%H5927><s%>;

And they encamped <S%H2583><s%> against them <S%H7843><s%>, and destroyed the increase <S%H2981><s%> of the earth <S%H776><s%>, until you come <S%H935><s%> unto Gaza <S%H5804><s%>, and left <S%H7604><s%> no sustenance <S%H4241><s%> for Israel <S%H3478><s%>, neither sheep <S%H7716><s%>, nor ox <S%H7794><s%>, nor donkey <S%H2543><s%>.

For they came up <S%H5927><s%> with their cattle <S%H4735><s%> and their tents <S%H168><s%>, and they came <S%H935><s%> as <S%H1767><s%> grasshoppers <S%H697><s%> for multitude <S%H7230><s%>; for both they and their camels <S%H1581><s%> were outside number <S%H4557><s%>: and they entered <S%H935><s%> into the land <S%H776><s%> to destroy it <S%H7843><s%>.

And Israel <S%H3478><s%> was greatly <S%H3966><s%> impoverished <S%H1809><s%> because <S%H6440><s%> of the Midianites <S%H4080><s%>; and the sons <S%H1121><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> cried <S%H2199><s%> unto the Lord <S%H3068><s%>.
And it came to pass <S%H1121><s%>, when the sons of Israel <S%H3478><s%> cried <S%H2199><s%> unto the Lord <S%H3068><s%> because <S%H182><s%> of the Midianites <S%H4080><s%>,

That the Lord <S%H3068><s%> sent <S%H7971><s%> a prophet <S%H376><s%> unto the sons <S%H1121><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%>, which said <S%H559><s%> unto them <S%H559><s%>, Thus says the Lord <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%>, I brought you up <S%H5927><s%> from Egypt <S%H4714><s%>, and brought you forth <S%H3318><s%> out of the house <S%H1004><s%> of bondage <S%H5650><s%>;

And I delivered <S%H5337><s%> you out of the hand <S%H3027><s%> of the Egyptians <S%H4714><s%>, and out of the hand <S%H3027><s%> of all that oppressed <S%H3905><s%> you <S%H1644><s%>, and drove them out from before <S%H6440><s%> you <S%H5414><s%>, and gave you their land <S%H776><s%>;

And I said <S%H559><s%> unto you <S%H3068><s%>, I am the Lord your God <S%H430><s%>; fear <S%H3372><s%> not the gods <S%H430><s%> of the Amorites <S%H567><s%>, in whose land <S%H776><s%> you live <S%H3427><s%>: but you have not obeyed <S%H8085><s%> my voice <S%H6963><s%>.

And there came <S%H935><s%> an angel <S%H4397><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%>, and sat <S%H3427><s%> under an oak <S%H424><s%> which was in Ophrah <S%H6084><s%>, that pertained unto Joash <S%H3101><s%> the Abi <S%H33><s%>–ezrite: and his son <S%H1121><s%> Gideon <S%H1439><s%> threshed <S%H2251><s%> wheat <S%H2406><s%> by the winepress <S%H1660><s%>, to hide <S%H5127><s%> it from <S%H6440><s%> the Midianites <S%H4080><s%>.

And the angel <S%H4397><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> appeared <S%H7200><s%> unto him <S%H559><s%>, and said unto him <S%H3068><s%>, The Lord is with you <S%H1368><s%>, you mighty man of valor <S%H2428><s%>.

And Gideon <S%H1439><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto him <S%H994><s%>, Oh my Lord <S%H113><s%>, if <S%H3426><s%> the Lord <S%H3068><s%> be with us <S%H4672><s%>, why then is all this happened us <S%H6381><s%>? and where be all his miracles which our fathers <S%H1><s%> told <S%H5608><s%> us of <S%H559><s%>, saying, Did not the Lord <S%H3068><s%> bring us up <S%H5927><s%> from Egypt <S%H4714><s%>? but now the Lord <S%H3068><s%> has forsaken <S%H5203><s%> us <S%H5414><s%>, and delivered us into the hands <S%H3709><s%> of the Midianites <S%H4080><s%>.

And the Lord <S%H3068><s%> looked <S%H6437><s%> upon him <S%H559><s%>, and said, Go <S%H3212><s%> in this your might <S%H3581><s%>, and you shall save <S%H3467><s%> Israel <S%H3478><s%> from the hand <S%H3709><s%> of the Midianites <S%H4080><s%>: have not I sent you <S%H7971><s%>

And he said <S%H559><s%> unto him <S%H994><s%>, Oh my Lord <S%H136><s%>, with which <S%H4100><s%> shall I save <S%H3467><s%> Israel <S%H3478><s%>? behold <S%H504><s%>, my family is poor <S%H1800><s%> in Manasseh <S%H4519><s%>, and I am the least <S%H6810><s%> in my father <S%H1><s%>'s house <S%H1004><s%>.
And the Lord <S%H3068><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto him <S%H5221><s%>, Surely I will be with you, and you shall strike the Midianites <S%H4080><s%> as one <S%H259><s%> man <S%H376><s%>.

And he said <S%H559><s%> unto him <S%H4672><s%>, If now I have found grace <S%H2580><s%> in your sight <S%H5869><s%>, then show <S%H6213><s%> me a sign <S%H226><s%> that you talk with me <S%H1696><s%>.

Depart <S%H4185><s%> not here <S%H935><s%>, I pray you, until I come unto you <S%H3318><s%>, and bring forth my present <S%H4503><s%>, and set <S%H3240><s%> it before <S%H6440><s%> you <S%H559><s%>. And he said, I will stay <S%H3427><s%> until you come again <S%H7725><s%>.

And Gideon <S%H1439><s%> went in <S%H935><s%>, and made ready <S%H6213><s%> a kid <S%H5795><s%>, and unleavened cakes <S%H4682><s%> of an ephah <S%H374><s%> of flour <S%H7058><s%>: the flesh <S%H1320><s%> he put <S%H7760><s%> in a basket <S%H5536><s%>, and he put <S%H7760><s%> the broth <S%H4839><s%> in a pot <S%H6517><s%>, and brought it out <S%H3318><s%> unto him under the oak <S%H424><s%>, and presented it <S%H5066><s%>.

And the angel <S%H4397><s%> of God <S%H430><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto him <S%H3947><s%>, Take the flesh <S%H1320><s%> and the unleavened cakes <S%H4682><s%>, and lay <S%H3240><s%> them upon this <S%H1975><s%> rock <S%H5553><s%>, and pour out <S%H8210><s%> the broth <S%H4839><s%>. And he did so <S%H6213><s%>.

Then the angel <S%H4397><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> put forth <S%H7971><s%> the end <S%H7097><s%> of the staff <S%H4938><s%> that was in his hand <S%H3027><s%>, and touched <S%H5060><s%> the flesh <S%H1320><s%> and the unleavened cakes <S%H4682><s%>; and there rose up <S%H5927><s%> fire <S%H784><s%> out of the rock <S%H6697><s%>, and consumed <S%H398><s%> the flesh <S%H1320><s%> and the unleavened cakes <S%H4682><s%>. Then the angel <S%H4397><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> departed <S%H1980><s%> out of his sight <S%H5869><s%>.

And when Gideon <S%H1439><s%> perceived <S%H7200><s%> that he was an angel <S%H4397><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%>, Gideon <S%H1439><s%> said <S%H559><s%>, Alas <S%H162><s%>, O Lord <S%H136><s%> God <S%H3069><s%>! for because <S%H3651><s%> I have seen <S%H7200><s%> an angel <S%H4397><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> face <S%H6440><s%> to face <S%H6440><s%>.
And the Lord <S%H3068><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto him <S%H7965><s%>, Peace be unto you <S%H3372><s%>; fear not <S%H4191><s%>: you shall not die.

Then Gideon <S%H1439><s%> built <S%H1129><s%> an altar <S%H4196><s%> there unto the Lord <S%H3068><s%>, and called <S%H7121><s%> it Jehovah <S%H3073><s%>–shalom: unto this day <S%H3117><s%> it is yet in Ophrah <S%H6084><s%> of the Abi <S%H33><s%>–ezrites.

And it came to pass the same night <S%H3915><s%>, that the Lord <S%H3068><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto him <S%H3947><s%>, Take your father <S%H1><s%>'s young <S%H6499><s%> bullock <S%H7794><s%>, even the second <S%H8145><s%> bullock <S%H6499><s%> of seven <S%H7651><s%> years old <S%H8141><s%>, and throw down <S%H2040><s%> the altar <S%H4196><s%> of Baal <S%H1168><s%> that your father <S%H1><s%> has <S%H3772><s%>, and cut down the grove that is by it <S%H842><s%>:

And build <S%H1129><s%> an altar <S%H4196><s%> unto the Lord <S%H3068><s%> your God <S%H430><s%> upon the top <S%H7218><s%> of this rock <S%H4581><s%>, in the ordered place <S%H4634><s%>, and take <S%H3947><s%> the second <S%H8145><s%> bullock <S%H6499><s%>, and offer <S%H5927><s%> a burnt sacrifice <S%H5930><s%> with the wood <S%H6086><s%> of the grove <S%H842><s%> which you shall cut down <S%H3772><s%>.

Then Gideon <S%H1439><s%> took <S%H3947><s%> ten <S%H6235><s%> men <S%H582><s%> of his servants <S%H5650><s%>, and did <S%H6213><s%> as the Lord <S%H3068><s%> had said <S%H1696><s%> unto him <S%H3372><s%>: and so it was, because he feared his father <S%H1><s%>'s household <S%H1004><s%>, and the men <S%H582><s%> of the city <S%H5892><s%>, that he could not do <S%H6213><s%> it by day <S%H3119><s%>, that he did <S%H6213><s%> it by night <S%H3915><s%>.

And when the men <S%H582><s%> of the city <S%H5892><s%> arose early <S%H7925><s%> in the morning <S%H1242><s%>, behold <S%H4196><s%>, the altar of Baal <S%H1168><s%> was cast down <S%H5422><s%>, and the grove <S%H842><s%> was cut down <S%H3772><s%> that was by it <S%H8145><s%>, and the second bullock <S%H6499><s%> was offered <S%H5927><s%> upon the altar <S%H4196><s%> that was built <S%H1129><s%>.

And they said <S%H559><s%> one <S%H376><s%> to another <S%H7453><s%>, Who has done <S%H6213><s%> this thing <S%H1697><s%>? And when they inquired <S%H1875><s%> and asked <S%H1245><s%>, they said <S%H559><s%>, Gideon <S%H1439><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Joash <S%H3101><s%> has done <S%H6213><s%> this thing <S%H1697><s%>.

Then the men <S%H582><s%> of the city <S%H5892><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto Joash <S%H3101><s%>, Bring out <S%H3318><s%> your son <S%H1121><s%>, that he may die <S%H4191><s%>: because he has cast down <S%H5422><s%> the altar <S%H4196><s%> of Baal <S%H1168><s%>, and because he has cut down <S%H3772><s%> the grove that was by it <S%H842><s%>.

And Joash <S%H3101><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto all that stood <S%H5975><s%> against him <S%H7378><s%>, Will you plead for Baal <S%H1168><s%>? will you save <S%H3467><s%> him <S%H7378><s%>? he that will plead for him <S%H4191><s%>, let him be put to death whilst it is yet morning <S%H1242><s%>: if he be a god <S%H430><s%>, let him plead <S%H7378><s%> for himself <S%H5422><s%>, because one has cast down his altar <S%H4196><s%>.

Therefore on that day <S%H3117><s%> he called <S%H7121><s%> him Jerubbaal <S%H3378><s%>, saying <S%H559><s%>, Let Baal <S%H1168><s%> plead <S%H7378><s%> against him <S%H5422><s%>, because he has thrown down his altar <S%H4196><s%>.

Then all the Midianites <S%H4080><s%> and the Amalekites <S%H6002><s%> and the sons <S%H1121><s%> of the east <S%H6924><s%> were gathered <S%H622><s%> together <S%H3162><s%>, and went over <S%H5674><s%>, and pitched <S%H2583><s%> in the valley <S%H6010><s%> of Jezreel <S%H3157><s%>.

But the Spirit <S%H7307><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> came <S%H3847><s%> upon Gideon <S%H1439><s%>, and he blew <S%H8628><s%> a trumpet <S%H7782><s%>; and Abi <S%H44><s%>–ezer was gathered <S%H2199><s%> after him <S%H310><s%>.

And he sent <S%H7971><s%> messengers <S%H4397><s%> throughout all Manasseh <S%H4519><s%>; who also was gathered <S%H2199><s%> after <S%H310><s%> him <S%H7971><s%>: and he sent messengers <S%H4397><s%> unto Asher <S%H836><s%>, and unto Zebulun <S%H2074><s%>, and unto Naphtali <S%H5321><s%>; and they came up <S%H5927><s%> to meet them <S%H7125><s%>.
And Gideon <S%H1439><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto God <S%H430><s%>, If you will <S%H3426><s%> save <S%H3467><s%> Israel <S%H3478><s%> by my hand <S%H3027><s%>, as you have said <S%H1696><s%>,

Behold <S%H3322><s%>, I will put a fleece <S%H1492><s%> of wool <S%H6785><s%> in the floor <S%H1637><s%>; and if the dew <S%H2919><s%> be on the fleece <S%H1492><s%> only <S%H2721><s%>, and it be dry upon all the earth <S%H776><s%> beside <S%H3045><s%>, then shall I know that you will save <S%H3467><s%> Israel <S%H3478><s%> by my hand <S%H3027><s%>, as you have said <S%H1696><s%>.

And it was so <S%H7925><s%>: for he rose up early on the next day <S%H4283><s%>, and thrust <S%H2115><s%> the fleece <S%H1492><s%> together <S%H2115><s%>, and wrung <S%H4680><s%> the dew <S%H2919><s%> out of the fleece <S%H1492><s%>, a bowl <S%H5602><s%> full <S%H4393><s%> of water <S%H4325><s%>.

And Gideon <S%H1439><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto God <S%H430><s%>, Let not your anger <S%H639><s%> be hot <S%H2734><s%> against me <S%H1696><s%>, and I will speak but this once <S%H6471><s%>: let me prove <S%H5254><s%>, I pray you <S%H6471><s%>, but this once with the fleece <S%H1492><s%>; let it now be dry <S%H2721><s%> only upon the fleece <S%H1492><s%>, and upon all the ground <S%H776><s%> let there be dew <S%H2919><s%>.
And God <S%H430><s%> did <S%H6213><s%> so that night <S%H3915><s%>: for it was dry <S%H2721><s%> upon the fleece <S%H1492><s%> only <S%H2919><s%>, and there was dew on all the ground <S%H776><s%>.
